content.text:
# Recent ElizaOS Repository Updates

The ElizaOS repository has seen significant activity with numerous bug fixes, new features, and test improvements. Here's a summary of the recent changes:

## New Plugins and Features

- A news plugin has been added (PR #1248)
- A new plugin for the Zilliqa blockchain was introduced (PR #2842)
- Added a Telegram client for account integration (PR #2839)
- Implemented an XMTP Client (PR #2786)
- Created a Gelato plugin relay (PR #2799)
- Added support for the Apro plugin (PR #2794)
- Introduced an arbitrage plugin with example character (PR #2784)
- Added the Trikon plugin (PR #2653)
- Integrated Deva client (PR #1238)
- Enhanced Twitter functionality with media posting capabilities (PR #2818)
- Added Access Token Management to the MultiversX Plugin (PR #2810)
- Improved message parsing (PR #2772)
- Added new README files and reorganized existing ones for consistency (PR #2828)

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed a bug in goal objectives update lookup logic (PR #2791)
- Updated bs58 version to resolve integration test dependency issues (PR #2848)
- Simplified and fixed exports in the Imgflip meme generation plugin (PR #2846)
- Fixed issues in multiple plugins including:
  - Story plugin (PR #2844)
  - SUI plugin (PR #2843)
  - Suno plugin (PR #2840)
  - Akash splash (PR #2838, PR #2816)
  - TEE Marlin plugin (PR #2837)
  - TEE Verifiable Log plugin (PR #2836)
  - ThirdWeb plugin (PR #2833)
  - TON plugin (PR #2832)
  - TTS plugin (PR #2829)
  - Twitter plugin (PR #2827)
  - Udio plugin (PR #2824)
  - Video Generation plugin (PR #2823)
  - Zerion plugin (PR #2822)
  - zkSync Era plugin (PR #2819)
- Updated cookie dependency to v0.7.0 to address security issues (PR #2834)
- Improved Farcaster client loop to continue running even if errors occur (PR #2830)
- Fixed NVIDIA NIM environment (PR #2817)
- Added exclusion for extra folder to improve future rebase speed (PR #2813)

## Testing and Documentation

- Added test configuration and coverage for multiple plugins:
  - Anyone plugin (PR #2854)
  - 3D Generation plugin (PR #2850)
  - 0x plugin (PR #2807)
  - 0g plugin (PR #2805)
- Updated documentation:
  - Updated embedding function documentation (PR #2821)
  - Updated Telegram client README (PR #2814)
  - Created Discord client README (PR #2812)

## Other Updates

- Added BTCfun Plugin (PR #2797)
- Updated initialization for BTCfun & Trikon plugins (PR #2643)

categories.title: Crypto, DAOs, and AI: Perspectives from @dankvr and @shawmakesmagic

content.text: The Twitter users @dankvr and @shawmakesmagic share insights on the intersection of cryptocurrency, Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs), and artificial intelligence. They discuss how recent developments like DeepSeek are changing perceptions about crypto AI's potential compared to established AI companies.

Both users emphasize the importance of DAOs in the future of crypto and AI. @dankvr shares that 'DAOs are the endgame for crypto and AI' and references the newly released 'How To DAO' book along with a spreadsheet of 2025 DAO design ideas. They describe DAOs using the Kaizen philosophy of continuous improvement, suggesting that over time, organizations become 'more cybernetic, autonomous, and unstoppable.'

There's discussion about AI integration with crypto, with @dankvr mentioning that switching between AI providers like OpenAI and DeepSeek requires minimal code changes in agent frameworks. @shawmakesmagic notes that Eliza has supported DeepSeek for about two weeks.

@shawmakesmagic expresses a desire for tokens to fund 'real science and tech with clear ROI' rather than just being 'mindshare or pure meme plays.' They suggest creating 'a real smart contract enforced way that the average person can invest in the next Uber or OpenAI and get a return,' noting the unfairness of current investment structures.

Both users touch on tokenomics, with @shawmakesmagic mentioning an upcoming series of explanations about their DAO tokenomics, starting with 'liquidity pooling the AUM,' with future discussions on 'launchpad, investment and a TV show.'

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: Several users have reported technical issues with the Eliza platform. User 'actuallyrizzn' reported two separate problems: one where Discord integration fails with an infinite typing loop (Issue #2792), and another where the headless web interface won't connect in version 0.1.8+build-1 (Issue #2795). User 'nicky-ru' identified a message ID collision issue in the Telegram client (Issue #2796).

There are also deployment issues being reported. User 'imransbaig' noted that the application won't run on Replit (Issue #2803), while 'photografereth' reported a crash with the Btcfun feature (Issue #2864).

Several plugin-related issues have been opened. Users have requested to add new plugins including 'plugin-apro' (Issue #2793), 'plugin-sui' (Issue #2851), and there's work being done on 'plugin-asterai' regarding test configuration and coverage (Issue #2859). Additionally, there's a discussion about 'node-llama-cpp' integration (Issue #2815).
A feature request has been submitted by 'Resister-boy' to collect information from Telegram groups or Discord channels (Issue #2856), which could enhance the platform's data gathering capabilities.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests to elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and plugins have been proposed for the Eliza framework through recent pull requests. These include:

1. Access Token Management (PR #2808) by elpulpo0

2. Deribit client and plugin integration (PR #2809) by uwecerron

3. Gelato plugin relay (PR #2799) by anirudhmakhana

4. APRO plugin support (PR #2794) by fifahuihua

5. News plugin (PR #1248) by ileana-pr

6. Storyteller feature (PR #2831) by Mettulus

7. Hyperliquid plugin with WebSocket support (PR #1497) by AIFlowML

8. OKX DEX integration (PR #2865) by Julian-dev28

9. Arbitrage plugin with example character (PR #2784) by mmarfinetz

These pull requests demonstrate ongoing development to expand Eliza's capabilities, particularly in financial services, content generation, and system management.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 26-27, 2025, there were 12 new pull requests with 2 merged, 8 new issues created, and 21 active contributors. Activity increased substantially the following day (January 27-28, 2025) with 39 new pull requests, 42 merged PRs, 11 new issues, and 40 active contributors working on the project.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are, their contributions, or any statistics related to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
